title: 112_s1592
content: The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" may be cited as the short title. Eligibility for farm loans is addressed in the Act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" addresses eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act. It includes provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" amends eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans under the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act by including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also renumbers certain sections within the Act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" updates eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans by including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also renumbers certain sections within the Act. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" updates eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans by including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also renumbers certain sections within the Act, including special rules regarding determinations for certain operating-only entities and embedded entities. The "Agricultural Credit Expansion Act" updates eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans by including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. It also specifies that an entity must have at least 75 percent of ownership interests owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm to meet the direct ownership requirement. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act updates eligibility requirements for farm ownership loans, including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. It mandates that entities must have 75 percent of ownership interests owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm to meet the direct ownership requirement. The Agricultural Credit Expansion Act updates eligibility requirements for farm operating loans, including provisions for limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. The Secretary updates eligibility requirements for farm operating loans to include limited liability companies and other legal entities deemed appropriate. The Secretary updates eligibility requirements for farm operating loans to include various legal entities determined to be appropriate. Special rules apply to entities owned by other entities. The eligibility requirements for farm operating loans are updated to include legal entities, with special rules for entities owned by other entities. The entity must be owned directly or indirectly by individuals who own the family farm. Amendments are made to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act regarding emergency loans, specifying eligibility criteria for farm ownership loans and operators. Limited liability companies are also included in the eligibility requirements. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act include expanding eligibility criteria for farm ownership loans to include limited liability companies and other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act expand eligibility for farm ownership loans to include limited liability companies and other legal entities as determined appropriate by the Secretary. The criteria for direct ownership requirement now includes entities owned by other entities where each individual owner of the family farm has an ownership interest in each entity. The direct ownership requirement for farm ownership loans now includes entities owned by other entities, where each individual owner of the family farm has an ownership interest in each entity. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act also include conforming amendments to specific sections. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act involve changing specific sections related to ownership requirements for farm ownership loans. This includes updating references from paragraphs to clauses in section 302(a) and expanding the definition of eligible entities to include various legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. Amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act involve updating ownership requirements for farm ownership loans. This includes expanding the definition of eligible entities to include farm cooperatives, private corporations, partnerships, or other legal entities deemed appropriate by the Secretary. The amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act involve updating ownership requirements for farm ownership loans by expanding the definition of eligible entities to include farm cooperatives, private corporations, partnerships, or other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. This includes changes to subparagraphs (C) and (D) regarding joint operations and owners. The amendments to the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act involve updating ownership requirements for farm ownership loans by expanding the definition of eligible entities to include farm cooperatives, private corporations, partnerships, or other legal entities determined appropriate by the Secretary. This includes changes to joint operations and owners in the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to include farm cooperatives, private corporations, partnerships, or other legal entities as eligible entities for ownership loans. Changes are made to joint operations and owners in the Act. The Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act is amended to allow refinancing of loans made or guaranteed under the Act. Loan term limits are repealed. SEC. 4 of the Consolidated Farm and Rural Development Act repeals loan term limits for direct loans and limitations on the period borrowers are eligible for guaranteed assistance.
